form.definition: noun X is the 24th letter of the English alphabet.

noun You use x to represent the name of a person or place when you can't or don't want to use their real name. The head of the drug ring in Australia is Mr Xhe's known to police as a prominent Sydney businessman.
noun In algebra, x is used as a symbol to represent an unknown value. 2x + 2y ;eq 6
abbreviation for Christmas in informal written English.
noun X-rays are a type of radiation that can pass through solid objects. They are used to take photographs of the inside of things, such as the human body and luggage at airports.

noun An x-ray is a photograph of the inside of part of the human body taken by x-rays. Doctors use these to help them diagnose a patient's condition or disease. They took an x-ray just to be sure my arm wasn't broken.
